com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.internal.parameter

Class ArgumentFlags

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.breadmoirai.breadbot.framework.internal.parameter.ArgumentFlags

  • public final class ArgumentFlags
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds flags for ArgumentParsing.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String HEX
      Signifies that this numeric argument is in hexadecimal form.
      static java.lang.String STRICT
      Signifies that the ArgumentTypeMapper should do everything it can to map to it's type.

    • Field Detail

      • STRICT

        public static final java.lang.String STRICT
        Signifies that the ArgumentTypeMapper should do everything it can to map to it's type. This has no effect on numeric types.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HEX

        public static final java.lang.String HEX
        Signifies that this numeric argument is in hexadecimal form.
        See Also:

        public static int getFlags(java.lang.String... flagNames)
        Uses a bit-wise OR to combine the specified flag. If a flag is not found, a warning is issued.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getFlag

        public static int getFlag(java.lang.String flagName)
        Gets the bit indicator of the flag.
        Parameters:
        flagName - the name of the flag
        Returns:
        the value if found, otherwise 0

      • isStrict

        public static boolean isStrict(int flags)
        true means that the CommandArgument should only be matched to this type when explicitly specified such as a Mention.

        If a flag is NOT strict, The mapper should try it's best to match it to the type provided such as searching for a matching name in case of a User or Channel.

        Parameters:
        flags - the int value.
        Returns:
        true if the flag indicates to use a Strict Strategy.

      • hasFlag

        public static boolean hasFlag(int flags,
                              java.lang.String flagName)
        checks if the provided int value contains the specified flag.
        Parameters:
        flags - the flag value to test.
        flagName - the name of the flag.
        Returns:
        true if the value contains the specified flag, otherwise false. If the given flagName is not registered, false will be returned.

      • hasFlags

        public static boolean hasFlags(int flags,
                               java.lang.String... flagNames)
